Name: Nocturno
Description:
Winner of the 2006 Italian game design contest Mysteria, Nocturno is a fast paced board game for 3/4 players.

Night falls over De Mortis Plaza and incautious human beings find themselves involved in the eternal struggle between supernatural creatures. Blood-thirsted vampires, putrid Zombies and werewolves will be the actors of a terrible dance of death. Who will survive this full moon night?

UPDATE: Nocturno is now free in its english edition! Feel free to download the files from the "Files" section of this page. Enjoy!

Name: Mega Zatrikion
Description:
Mega Zatrikion is an  ancient and Byzantine chess game. This chess game has seven variations according to the more ancient board game of "Pessoi".

These versions have all the known pawns of  modern chess with a bigger grid.  In some variations there are additional pawns connected to ancient philosophy.

Played with Mega Zatrikion in some versions are three dice with the ancient shapes of various eras and in this version the highest roll starts the game.

Mega Zatrikion has the following items:
1. One colorful Board (Grid)12x12.
2. The pawns of each player are a different color. Colors are the veneti (red color) and the greens (green color).   
3. Three dice with shapes.
4. Other material.
5. A book with some information for this game along with photos.

Name: Agincourt
Description:
Agincourt is, as far as the English are concerned, one of the most remarkable, and famous, battles in medieval history.

Makes most Englishmen almost forget what a sour-faced prig Henry V really was. Outnumbered by as much as 4 to 1, tired, sick and in pitiful shape, Henry V’s rag-tag army raised the three basic precepts of English tactics of the era to their greatest height:  the defensive power of the longbow, a good defensive position, and the effectiveness of a creative and powerful overall command.  The French?  They rolled sixes on life’s CRT all day. That, and having dozens of dukes and counts insist each one was supposed to be in command and at the head of every charge, plus a full morning’s carousing, didn’t help.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: C'est la Vie! The Game of Lesbian Life
Description:
A limited edition board game manufactured by Play on Words in Ann Arbor, Michigan. The game had one printing of 2,000 copies, and was stocked in bookstores across America and Canada in the mid-nineties.

Players travel "the lesbian path of life" through areas such as "coming out", "career", "Womyn's Festival", and "Lovely Lesbians Retirement Villa"; each area with a separate card stack. 
    Some squares have you draw a karma card, which describes a social situation and how you did in the situation. Some cards give you one karma token (e.g. "You listen objectively to your straight friend's problems with her stupid boyfriend. Collect one token."), while some things cost you two karma tokens (e.g. "You see your best friend's girlfriend at a party - without your best friend - and make out with her until 4:00 am. Forfeit two tokens"). 
    Some squares are 'It's Time to Take Action" squares, which instruct you to perform some action: recite a limerick, tell about the first girl you had a crush on, do the hula, etc.

The winner of the game is the one with the most karma tokens at game end.

Name: Scouting
Description: This game with a copyright date of 1926 is called a "Great Pioneering Game for Boys". It is a simple roll and move game with the object being to be the first Scout to reach the Fort. Prairie fires, lightning strikes and falling trees are some of the obstacles you have to overcome on your trip into the Fort.

Name: Shuffles
Description: Shuffles is a Table Top Shuffleboard game that was produced by Aurora. The game comes with a little man with a spring loaded arm that pushes shuffleboard disks on the game board in an attempt to score points exactly as one would in Real Shuffleboard.

Name: Typhon
Description:
It is the time of Jason and of Hercules, of Achilles and Hector, the time of Mythological Greece. A time of Heroes and Legend, of Monsters and the Gods of Olympus. You may wish to emulate Odysseus and travel the world or gather the Argonauts and quest for the Golden Fleece. If you favour war then lay siege to Troy or Thebes, if you wish fame then seek out and destroy the Hydra of Lerna or the fabled Cyclopes or Minotaur or any of the other creatures of Greece. It is the Will of the Gods!

Alternative Armies' Skirmish level, character based, wargame for use with 50mm Greek Mythological miniatures.

Name: Wikinger an Bord
Description:
Each player attempts to move their own Vikings from their island to their own Viking Longboat, moored off of an opponents island. To reach it, the Vikings must climb across a ship rigging.

Neptune is watching, growing angry. When a Viking arrives at their boat, Neptune sends a whirlwind that causes the ship rigging to "twist in the wind" {a portion of the game board is physically rotated).

Rules published in German only.

Name: Maelstrome
Description:
It is the Darke Age and darkness abounds.  In a time before the unleashing of Black Powder the third epoch in Valon's history is if anything more disjointed and scarred than the subsequent Age.  Morgana the Empress of the Crystal Elf Empire sits upon the Peacock Throne with her younger son Mordred at her knee, she has ruled a thousand years and in her resides the best chance to halt the decay.

Maelstrome is a fantasy mass combat system based in part on the famous Slaughterloo game and it features many of the same races and creatures that players will already be familiar with, though they are much changed.  Alongside the Crystal Elves, progenitors of the Ferach, are the Krautan Dwarves members of a League encompassing hundreds of small baronies and thiefdoms.  The Krautans are next in strength to the Crystal Empire and more powerful than the Cities of Man that have appeared across the central continent.   Other organized states try to hang onto the vestiges of a disappearing civilization but it has not been easy for the Undead led by the sinister Necromancers and the Dragon Children or Dracci have rampaged across Valon embroiled in their own huge war that decimates all who fall in its path.

From the frozen north the shambling Undead have crumbled many societies and created free booters and mercenaries who sell their swords to the highest bidders, among them the Gnome Legion and the Dogmen of Stasia.  It is in Alevia a former province of the Crystal Empire that the mighty Elf regiments make their stand against the Undead and the Dracci.  It is from the vast sea in the south beyond Ibe-Herra that the Dragons came bringing carnage to the Goblin Principalities behind their wooden walls and forming an alliance of convenience with the fawning Lizardmen.  Savage Orc tribes migrate across all these battle torn lands bringing more pain, though as always their enemies loose flights of barbed arrows upon their approach.

Choose your side carefully in the Maelstrome for though you may admire the remorseless Necromancers or the fury of the Dracci the other races have much to offer.  March with the Imperial Elf Regiments or the Regiments of the Wood Elves not forgetting the armies of Man or the Orc Tribes.  All can hire warriors from a common pool of fighters, entire units of Ogres, Mountain Orcs even Gnomes who kill with hundred tiny blades.  Do not forget of course that your army must have a powerful Mage to wield Wylde Magick in a nimbus of power to pour on your foes each race sports different lethal incantations.  Also you can use a Beast Handler to control huge savage monsters that are the doom of a multitude of soldiers, War Trolls and Corpse Monsters assembled from piles of the recently dead.

Once this army of yours is assembled and stands ready uniforms bright or armour rusted and well used you must select a Warlord and special leaders to drive your units forward.   In the Maelstrome all must fight for their own ends and alliances seldom last out a season.

Name: HOMopoly
Description: Here is another themed edition of Monopoly, this one created for a Metro Detroit charity event benefiting Hospice Of Michigan. All properties have been replaced with southeast Michigan business organization sponsors, such as Dow Automotive, The Detroit Free Press, Charity Motors, PVS Chemicals, Compuware, etc. The railroads have become Detroit People Mover stops. Pawns include a snowman, electric guitar, slot machine, spark plug, classic car, and the Ambassador bridge.

Name: Do you look like your dog?
Description:
From the Press Release:

In this outrageous game, players match dogs to owners and owners to dogs, and try to earn bones from other players, who vote on the best matches. Players have 30 seconds to state their case and bury their bones. And just when you think you are home free, you may find your opponent sneaking into your doghouse, and referring to you as a Shih Tzu! In the end, everyone’s bark is worse than their bite! Each game comes with 20 Owner Cards, 20 Dog Cards, 8 Go to the Dog House Cards, 24 Bones, 4 Tokens and game board. Complete game rules included. Designed for 2-4 players. Ages 7+

Name: Shindig
Description: This game is from the TV show "Shindig" which aired on ABC in 1965. It has 46 blue markers & the instructions on how to play. There are 240 Fact Cards.

Name: Jackpot
Description:
From the Press Release:

Jackpot! is a game of sequencing, logic and luck. The Jackpot game board features 9 squares covered by 8 bright fruit tiles -- leaving one blank space. Each player is dealt 6 cards showing fruit patterns. The object is to turn over one of your cards and create the pattern in as few moves as possible. A roll of the die determines the number of moves that you can make before going over “par” and having to add cards to your hand. Can you beat the odds? Create the pattern in fewer moves and discard cards. Be careful because your move may cause your opponent to spot a winning combination first and call out Jackpot! The first player to get rid of all his or her cards wins!

Jackpot! requires no reading skills and is a perfect multi-generational game for grandparents and parents to enjoy with the youngest members of the family. A complete set of rules and examples are enclosed.

Name: Slapagories
Description:
A spin-off of Scattergories.  Players sit around a small round board with the words "I know" on it.  There are two decks of round cards in special holders, one that has a single letter on each card, and one that has a category.  The decks are placed FACE UP.

The first player to say "I know", and slap the board, gets to take either the letter or the category card, which thus IMMEDIATELY changes the letter or the category - and starts the next "turn".  Conflicts are resolved via majority vote.

When either deck runs out, the game is over.  Whomever has the most cards wins.

Name: Cavaleiros do Rei
Description:
The players are the king's knights who attempt to rescue the princess from the Cursed Castle. They must battle the evil Morgana, but Merlin may help them.

It's a basic roll-and-move game, but the paths may change every turn by means of a gear system based on a colored die roll.  Players race to be the first to reach the princess imprisoned in the center of the board.
Families: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

Name: Bethesda Church
Description: ACW battle game on the fighting around Bethesda Church.

Name: Tea Party Game
Description:
The object of Tea Party is to be the first player to gather a complete place setting and tea time treats.

Players take turns twirling a tea pot spinner and collecting the seven items they need for afternoon tea (plate, napkin & utensils, tea cup, cream & sugar, sandwiches, fruit, dessert).  A plate must be collected before any food that would be served on a plate can be collected.  And if the spinner stops on the bees, the player must give back an item they have collected.

Name: Millionaire
Description:
From the box:  MILLIONAIRE CARD & BOARD  game is an entertaining family game. It has been developed so as to free it of complications, therefore requiring only a minimal amount of Mathematical skills.  Although it is a game of chance, the order in which the individual player plays his/her cards is of great importance.

The playing board is printed with consecutive boxes each with an additional $10,000.  Players use different color pegs to identify the amount in their account.  Al players start with an account of $00 and 3 cards.  Upon playing one of the cards during his/her turn of play, that card will be replaced with one from the unused cards.  The ultimate goal of the player is to first achieve an account of $1,000,000, or more or first bankrupt all the other players.

There are 50 money cards categorized into CASH, GRANT, and PAY comprising of 6 different denominations between $10,000 and $200,000.  As such a player's account will be credited and debited during various stages of the game.

Name: Thomas & Friends Mix ‘n Match Bingo Game
Description:
From the Press Release:

Preschoolers will delight in rolling 3 dice that create a one-of-a-kind picture. Match Harold, James, Toby, Thomas and Spencer images on the bingo board to the picture created by the dice. Four levels of play are included so the game grows along with your child. Develops observation and reasoning skills. No reading required. Complete game rules included plus 6 board games, 3 mix ‘n match dice and 36 color coded chips.
Families: TV Shows: Thomas the Tank Engine

Name: Thomas Making Tracks Game
Description:
From the Press Release:

Molly, Percy, James and Thomas need your help to build railway tracks from their sidings to the main line. Connect straight and curved tracks by matching colors on the spinner. Lastly, spin the spinner and chug your engine across the board, over a bridge and finally to the round house where Sir Topham Hatt awaits your arrival. Complete game rules included. For 2-4 players. Ages 4+.
Families: TV Shows: Thomas the Tank Engine

Name: Newton's Apples
Description:
From the Press Release:

Red and green apples are placed on “crates” in one of eight rows at the top of an elevated game board. Apples away! By strategically moving apple crates and using Newton’s law of gravity, be first to get all of your apples to fall to the bottom row, while blocking your opponent’s apples. In the race for gravity to do its job, players move crates vertically or horizontally, and even line up crates to build bridges to move apples into new rows. Complete game rules are included along with the three dimensional, molded plastic game board, 8 apples and 16 apple crates.

Name: I Spy Seeing Double
Description:
From the Press Release:

With two card game levels to play, youngsters can See Doubles (Ages 5+) or enjoy Matching Fun (Ages 3+). Both challenges allow children of all ages to use their eyes to spot objects in the blink of an eye – or at least before the other players. For 2-4 players. No reading required. Game includes 48 cards, 1 action die, 4 picture dice.

Name: I Spy 3D
Description:
From the Press Release:

Everyday objects leap off the cards when players wear their oh-so-cool 3-D glasses. Players read rhyme cards and search to find floating objects that they can almost touch on a colorful game board that they create using 40 3-D tiles and 10 rhyme cards. By mixing up the tiles, no two game boards are alike. Collect the most tiles to win. For 2-4 players. Complete game rules are included. Ages 5+.

Name: 24 CTU Undercover
Description:
From the Press Release:

In this political thriller it’s up to the players to spy, interrogate and reveal CTU’s plans as they foil yet another terrorist plot. The game features a unique system to track plan details on a cell phone game piece. Other players may call you by placing a die cut screen of their choice over your cell phone, revealing key information. Be the first to correctly identify another player’s plans and win CTU Undercover. Ages 12 and up. 2-4 players.

Buy Microbadge - 24 fan


Buy Microbadge - Kiefer Sutherland is a character Jack Bauer plays when he's not saving the world.

Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Card Game
Description:
From the Press Release:

This travel-size card game asks players ages 6 and up to join forces to defeat Max Winters and his Alien army. The 52-card pack features Briarpatch’s transparent “see thru” cards. Each game comes with 40 TMNT cards, 10 Alien cards and 2 rule cards. For 2-4 players.
Families: Comic Books: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Movie Game
Description:
Unfold this game board to reveal the sewers and manholes of Manhattan plus the ever-changing headlines of the New York Daily.

Players ages 6 and up use their ninja skills to capture Max Winters’ Alien mob while scoring the most points. Turtle power rules in this fast-paced game but beware! Players may not only capture but can also allow Aliens to escape. Each game box includes a spinner, 22 Turtle Power cards, 8 Alien cards, 18 Daily News Cards, 4 TMNT tokens plus a game board. The TMNT Movie Game was created for 2-4 players.
Families: Comic Books: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Name: A Guerra do Congo 1998-1999
Description:
This wargame simulates the events that occurred between August of 1999 and November of 1999, in Central Africa.
The game is divided in turns, each turn corresponds to one week of real time. The totality of the events that this wargame intends to represent are between 2nd August 98 and the 14th of November 1998, therefore 15   game turns.
    
Game material : 
- A map of A2 size.
- 202 tokens representing combatant units and markers.
- A book of rules
- Seven Tables and Four Markers.
Families: Country: Democratic Republic of the Congo

Name: A Guerra do Anel O Wargame
Description:
This game simulates the famous battle of Minias Thirith in the 3rd Book of Lord of The Rings, by JRR Tolkien.
This is a FREE wargame available in Portuguese.

The sequence of the game will be divided into turns, with at total of 15 turns.  Each turn corresponds to one day of real time. The events of this wargame take place from March 07 through March 21 of the Third Age.
Each turn will be divided in two stages and each stage corresponds with a single action of one of the armies.
The first stage is always the player who controls the Western Alliance.  The Western Alliance consists of Gondor, Rohan, Dol Amroth, Dunedain, Lebennim, and Laledon.  For the sake of simplicity, this player will be called GONDOR.  The opposing player controls the forces of Sauron consisting of the armies from Mordor, Harad, and the men of the east called Easterlings.  This player will be called MORDOR.

Each stage is divided in 3 sequential phases, representing the grouping of similar actions. The Preparation Phase, the Movement Phase, and the Combat Phase.

After 15 turns the player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Balkan Gambit, 1943-1945
Description:
Balkan Gambit is a military simulation exploring the alternative-historical premise that the Allied powers have chosen to invade southern Europe via Greece, Albania, and Yugoslavia in the latter half of World War II. Nothing like this actually happened, though the Allies went to great lengths to convince the Axis powers that such plans were intended in order to mislead them 
as to their true intentions. Nonetheless, some Allied strategists and leaders, including Winston Churchill, believed that an invasion of Europe via the Balkans was a legitimate and war-winning activity. Hence, the game is partially a reflection of the concepts and anxieties of both sides.

Each hex on the map equals about 20 miles (about 30 km) when measured from side to opposite side. Each game turn represents 2-5 days, depending on the scenario chosen and the weather currently in effect. Every ground unit represents a division, division-equivalent, or brigade of about 5,000 to 20,000 men and/or 50 to 350 armored fighting vehicles.[...]

This game has 3 scenarios: 
– Operation BOARDMAN: In summer 1943, the British 8th Army is sent to liberate Greece and Crete. This was a deception to cover Operations HUSKY and AVALANCHE, the historical invasions of Sicily and Salerno.[...]
– Operation ZEPPELIN: In summer 1944, the notional British 12th Army attacks Greece and Albania while the US 7th Army attacks in Dalmatia, in concert with Soviet amphibious operations against the coast of Rumania and Bulgaria. This plan was part of Operation BODYGUARD, the overall deception plan to disguise Operations OVERLORD and ANVIL (the invasions of northern and southern France).[...]
– Operation GELIGNITE: Actual plans were drawn up to send the British 8th Army across the Adriatic in late 1944 or early 1945 to cut off the final retreat of German Army Group F and forestall any further Soviet advances towards northern Italy. The plan was shelved due to shortages of troops and landing craft.[...]

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters

(source: rulebook and user's description)

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2-5 days (depending on scenario)
Hex: 20 miles / 30 kilometers
Units: Brigade to Division

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15

Name: Escape das Estepes
Description:
Escape of the Estepes is an introductory system to wargames for people who never had a contact with this type of game. The objective is here to show how strategy games can be fascinating, promote the development of strategical reasoning and the taste for history.

In 1944 Germany already is already withdrawing from the Soviet Union. Diverse elements of the German army, withdrew desperately to form a new line of defense. Many were imprisoned and tried to escape.

FREE wargame in Portuguese in Strategos #0:
http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/miniaturas.html

Name: Maillot Jaune
Description:
Maillot Jaune (Yellow Jersey) is a hard to find hand-made cycling simulation by the Swiss Patrick Inauen that developed with support from his brother Adrian. Its main purpose is to recreate the Tour de France in its entirety over 14 stage sessions, with each player in charge of a team of 8 riders with individual abilities.

But what you get, in essence, is a highly flexible modular stage construction kit that allows you to create a wide range of possible races for 6 teams of 8 riders each, using 136 plain-colored terrain tiles in 5 colors. And although its scope is for an entire Tour, it is equally feasible to play only a single stage, recreate other tours and existing one-day classics, or embark on a completely made-up race. Saying that, a lot of the dynamics only come into play when team managers aren't only trying to snatch the stage victory from their competitors, but need to keep an eye on the overall rankings for each individual rider as well, as the end goal is to carry the Yellow Jersey to Paris. More so, and just like in the real Tour, the Sprint and Mountain Tricots are also up for grabs, so during each race it is important to get your key riders in point-scoring positions at the right time.

This dice-driven racing simulation includes rules for terrain handling, breakaways, tempo raising, slipstreaming, pack-splitting, sprints, fatigue, doping-use, overtaking, falls, team-cooperation and other events, but squeezes all this in a simple system that does not bogs down in details or oodles of bookkeeping.

By stripping the inner workings of a cycling race down to core mechanics that are based around only 4 different types of terrain tile (flat, uphill, downhill, and - to settle communal arrivals - sprints), the game instead concentrates on the different abilities of each rider to use certain types of terrain to his advantage. These abilities, again, are stripped down to their core. Team sheets show 8 unique riders, each with 4 to 8 special action points in specific terrain colours, that get covered when used. Remarkably, this is enough creates a race dynamic that is genuinely similar to the real deal. Servants will be used to get the specialists in position, or bridge gaps to escaped groups or soloists. The stronger riders will use their abilities to snatch points on their favourite type of terrain, and the team champions will be protected by their team members for most of the race, but ultimately need to rely on their superior movement bonuses to battle it out amongst each other. Often, the mountain stages are key arenas that shape the face of the remaining Tour, when riders no longer can rely on group efforts, and have to face the long uphill climb on individual strength alone. Each stage, team leaders will need to balance the need for interteam co-operation against their individual team's chances to gain an advantage. Sounds familiar?

During the race, the starting pack will slowly split up in individual packs, smaller groups (2-7 riders) and soloists, all standing on their own terrain tiles in small stacks of numbered plastic pieces in the 6 team colors (for larger packs replacement markers are used). In a standard turn, the top cyclist on each tile-stack will throw the D20, and move 1 forwards on an odd roll, and 2 tiles on an even, taking the entire underlying stack along through slipstreaming. That cyclist will then have spent his energy and move to the bottom of the stack, handing over the front position to the next one in line. From the head of the race down, each tile with riders will be dealt with in turn, and that process repeats itself until all riders have completed the stage, or are disqualified for arriving too late, with a bigger time-gap to the leader than allowed.

Each standard (group) move can be modified by one special move if managers so desire, and if they have the rider(s) that can pull it off on that type of terrain. This special move can either be a breakaway attempt, a general raising of the tempo, a deliberately go-slow decision by the speed-setting rider, or a tactical manoeuvre that can cause a pack to split. Each time a rider uses a speciality point, it is marked off from his entry on the team sheet. When the last ability point has been covered up, that rider is too tired to pull off any further special moves. A rider that has spent all his bonus points will start the next stage fatigued, whereas a rider that has spared himself will enter the next stage with a bonus point, just like the new holder of the Yellow Jersey. When the race leader changes terrain type, a random event is triggered that can befall any rider in the race.

When more than 1 rider arrives at a sprint banner, the top of a mountain, or the finish line, a sprint is triggered to settle the differences. Riders who can draw on team support, or are natural sprinters can use this to start the sprint in advantageous positions.

This is a great game for fans of the cycling genre, but might be a tad repetitive for others, especially when a lot of team managers join the race and when the starting pack splits up in many different groups. It then takes quite a few die rolls before the 50 to 90 tile route has been conquered by all. As a sport simulation, it works best when a full field of riders is present, and when an entire tour is played out over multiple sessions. If you play individual stages only, the race dynamics are far less colourful since the team managers only need to focus on getting one rider through the finish line, rather than juggle positions, general fitness, and overall rankings of their entire team of riders.

Included with the set are the assembly instructions for the 14 stages, and team sheets for each team manager, detailing the individual abilities of 8 unique (real-life) riders from the 1995 tour. It isn't clear if the brothers intended to supply updated packs for subsequent tours and races, but enthusiasts have.

PUBLICATION HISTORY:

     1995 Maillot Jaune Inauen Spiele - handmade limited edition - out of print
     1996 Le Tour Inauen Spiele - handmade re-issue - out of print


Maillot Jaune was Patrick's debut game, and was launched at the Schweizer Spielmesse in 1995, where it sold all of 13 stickered white cardboard boxes. It re-appeared one year later in another limited hand-made production as "Le Tour". The lovingly assembled sets consist of plain colored tiles, generic plastic pieces, sticker sheets, and well-presented photocopied rules and team sheets. Both productions are long gone and very hard to trace down.

ADDITIONAL INFO:

     language skill needed: language neutral. Both versions come with German rules.
     english translation: None available.
     artwork: n/a 
     awards won: none.

Name: Spider-Man Ultimate Power
Description: Venom, Sandman and New Goblin are hiding among a city full of classic Spider-Man Villains. Do you possess the Ultimate Power to find and defeat them? The battle between good and evil matches Spider-Man’s Intelligence, Strength, Speed, Durability, Energy Projection and Fighting skills against those of the bad guys. After each battle, Spider-Man has to power up for the next one -- and he never knows when the headlines in the Daily Bugle will trumpet that a villain has escaped! The first player to capture all three movie villains wins! Complete game rules include the "Villain Challenge" for an added level of play.

Name: Spider-Man Web Slinger
Description:
From the Press Release:

Help Spider-Man win “the battle within” by catching Venom, Sandman, and New Goblin in his web! Players are given the power to sling their own webs by placing see-thru web cards atop villain cards of their choice. The color of the web must match the color of the border of the villain card. It takes four web cards to close the web and capture the villain. Rules include a Speed Version for advanced players. For 2-4 players, ages 6 and up.

Name: Armies At Lutzen
Description:
This game simulates the battle of Lutzen during the 30 years war.
The main part of the game consists of four decks: German, Imperial, Swede, and Fate.  The first three are unit decks and the last is an administrative deck. The Imperial and Swede Decks (and to a lesser extent the German Deck) are composed of various kinds of cards (Unit cards, Tactics cards, Terrain cards, Tactical Leader cards, and Commander cards).

Name: The Game of Checko
Description:
This is Milton Bradley game #4046, The Game of Checko, 1938.  Object is to skillfully place CHECKS on the CHECKO Board so that each row horizontally, vertically and diagonally will produce the highest score possible.

There are 8 CHECKO boards, 8 sets of colored CHECKS, each set having four of each number, 1 to 13.  1 Deck of CHECKO cards, four of each number, 1 to 13.

CHECKO boards consist of 5 rows and columns.

Score for each row, column and both diagonals as:
2 checks alike in a row = 1 point
2 sets of two checks alike in a row = 2 points
3 checks alike in a row = 3 points
sequence or any run of five checks in a row = 5 points
3 checks alike and 2 checks alike in a row = 7 points
4 checks alike in a row = 12 points
add one point for a score made diagonally.

Name: Jigquiz
Description:
A superb question and answer game. Very good for language development. Two packs of cards - letter cards and question cards. Ideal for the whole family to play. 
Jigquiz may also be played as a group activity with everyone writing down their answers to 10 or 20 questions.
A good game to keep in the glove box of the car to play while traveling.

Name: Cubeword
Description:
Cubeword is a crossword style game.  The game consists of 25 letter cubes packed into a plastic carry case. 24 of the cubes have letters on 5 faces, with one side left blank, with the last cube bearing the numbers 1-6.  Each letter appears in one of nine colors.

The basic game involves creating a crossword arrangement of words, either by adding cubes, rearranging existing words or rotating cubes to reveal new letters.

14 additional rule sets are included, with a few variants on the basic rules and a variety of additional games which take advantage of the number cube and the colored letters.

Name: Afrika
Description:
Afrika (German for: "Africa") was invented on March 2, 2004, by Ralf Gering in Germany. The game was added to Super Duper Games on November 2, 2006.

This modern mancala game has several unusual features:


     2x8 board
     capturing is compulsory
     capturing is considered a complete move
     capturing occurs when you have an empty hole


Afrika has a distinctive Draughts-like feeling because of its forced winning combinations.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

Name: Verbindung Gesucht
Description:
The game is played on a board divided into squares. One player is black, the opponent is red. Each has one starting square on each side of the board.
At each turn, the player rolls three dice with black/red patterns on it: curves or bridges of both colors, or white crossings useful for both players. The player choose two dice to be placed on the board wherever he wants, building paths across the board. (The first player rolls two dice for the first two turns, to balance the starting advantage.) White crosses must be chosen.
The player connecting his four starting squares wins. If in doing so he also connects his opponent's starting squares by mistake, he loses instead.

Name: Zebras & Löwen
Description:
2-4 players try to build enclosures for lions and zebras with fence tiles. The tile edges have different color and just similar color can be placed next to each other. As soon as a player builds an enclosure he places one of his animals within it. The first one to place all his animals wins the game.

This is an easy strategy game for children with wonderful artworks. Rules are in German, French and Italian.

Name: Girl Talk Secret Diary
Description:
This is Golden game #5058, Girl Talk Secret Diary, 1991.

"Have you ever wanted to find out someone else's secrets without having to tell your own?  That's exactly what you can do if you win at Secret Diary."

Object is to be the first player to collect 12 Calendar Cards -- one for each month of the year.  If you do, you'll get to read the Personal & Confidential secrets of your friends, while yours may remain a secret -- if you wish.

Name: All About Jefferson City
Description:
Another in the All About Town series.  Jefferson City (Missouri), 1983.  Object is for players, using dice and playing pieces, to acquire 8 Travel Cards by moving about the gameboard. (The length of the game may be varied by changing the number of cards required to win.)

Game includes $100 in Merchant Coupons.

Name: Skudo
Description:
"The object of the game is to be the first person to move his four pieces around the board and up the path of his color to Home."

Skudo is a traditional roll and move game that's reminiscent of Parcheesi, Sorry, and Trouble. The main differential elements are 4 on-board discs that allow only the matching color, passage to the paths beyond. By throwing doubles or landing on the "Skudo" space, one can turn a disc thereby continuing their movement or blocking their opponent.

Name: Pax: Game of the Century
Description:
Pax, the game of the Century seems to be the only game ever published by the Chesapeake Bay Trading Company, later known as the Foreign Advisory Service.  The publisher was a specialty import company that dealt mainly in Dutch and French dishes and pewter, Royal Leerdam, Delft, Quimper, etc.  No designer is listed.

The game consists of a deck of cards representing nations or geographic areas and the object is to complete a "hand" of nations that dominates the world political scene to the extent of being able to enforce a "Pax" similar to the ancient Pax Romana.  Specially stamped poker chips are used in bidding for cards.  Besides the rules and a score pad, the game came with a green felt playing surface with a map of the world and other significant items in white.  This surface is known in the rules as "the traditional green table of diplomacy".  The game came in two types of boxes, one a padded leatherette style and the other a red paper covered cardboard with trays to hold the cards and chips.  The smaller red box has a pocket inside the lid to hold the rules and score pad.

Four players is the optimum number, though rules are given for a three player game.  The four players represent the United States, Soviet Union, the United Kingdom, and either France or Germany, as picked by the dealer.  Play then proceeds until one player has built up a hand through either draws, auction, or trading large enough to declare his peculiar pax based on his political leanings.

The four types of Paxes are:
Pax Americana
Pax Muscovita
Pax Atlantica (the English Pax)
Pax Europeana (French or German Pax)

The game betrays its Cold War background by some of the interesting art and factoids on the cards, which are about three times the size of playing cards and are quite colorful with period artwork.  The rules are a scant two pages, but are easily picked up by any traditional card players who are familiar with bridge.  Certain cards are usable only with certain Paxes and vary in value.  The publisher boasted that "Pax is sold in all the free countries of the world."

Name: Operation Goodwood
Description:
After the initial success in “Day”, weeks of hard combats in Normandy had been fought. The region was ideal for the defense, with bocages, forests and rough land. The great allied advantages was the aerial supremacy and the great mobility of their units, had been almost annulled for closed combats far from the short and in difficult land.
The weather also did not help, with rain being a constant aspect of the campaign. Despite of this, the allies had kept the pressure and, with great difficulty, they had expanded the head-of-beach. The vital port of Cherbourg was conquered on 29/06/44, but the important city of Caen, entrance of the French plain was still in enemy hands. The Germans, recognizing its importance, had positioned their best troops there. In end of July, the commander of 1º American Army, General Omar N. Bradley, conceived the “Operation Snake”, aiming to break the front of Normandy. However, to be a success, the German tanks would have that to be kept where they were - in the English sector. It felt on the English to keep them there, through a strong attack. General Montgomery, the commander ally, the British infantry that was depleted after weeks of constant combat. It had suffered the majority of the 40,000 decreases registered in 2º British Army until July middle. It needed to attack, but he would have that to make it with its armored divisions. However, the land of Normandy was total inadequate to maneuver such mass of tank, not to be in the opened land more in the east of the head-of-beach, between Caen and Vimont. There, such action promised better chances. In function of this, the biggest operation of tank of the front occidental person was planned: the “Goodwood Operation”.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Trauma Case Inbound
Description:
Trauma Case Inbound is a game portraying an unusually hectic day at a hospital's emergency department. Its level of realism lies between that of actual medical procedures and emergency medicine as depicted in movies/television shows. Players will need to assign their limited numbers of doctors, nurses, and equipment based on available information on incoming patients, and personnel fatigue is a significant factor.

The game may be played either solitaire or multi-player (which is a "multi-solitaire" situation presenting each player with the same incoming patients). Multi-player interaction is possible by rerouting inbound patients to another player's hospital. There's no fixed limit on the number of players, but one to four is a reasonable range.

Components include:
7-page rulebook
Hospital Map
31 counters
106 markers
Game Display
Two Doctor/Nurse Displays
Patient Display
Sequence of Play
One six-sided die is required for play.

The Print-n-Play PDF can be found at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=492

Name: Rough Riders Ten-Pins
Description: The R. Bliss Manufacturing Company of Pawtucket, Rhode Island produced this "bowling game" at the turn of the century at just about the time that real TEN PIN BOWLING was taking hold in the United States. This game features heavy cardboard "pins" like Rough Rider, Indian, Cowboy Dude, and Cow Girl. Each pin had a number value marked on it. Knocking them over scored you the points listed on the individual pin. You had one shot to score. The pins were randomly set up by your opponent so the numbers on those pins were not in the same place on every turn. highest score after 10 "frames" won the game.

Name: Rickety Raft
Description:
APPROXIMATE BOX SIZE: 20.5" x 12.5" x 3"

The gameboard is a blue-aqua 12" square plastic bowl ('pond') about 2.5" deep with individual scoring tracks along each side lip. The 'pond' is filled with water before play and a plastic/polystyrene circular raft 5" wide is placed on the surface. The raft is divided into two different colored sections along its axis of symmetry. Each player starts with six (three pairs of) men of varying shape and weight (and value: 5 or 10 points) which must be placed on the raft without causing it to overbalance.

Players use a spinner to determine which particular weighted man must be placed on which side of the floating circular raft. When one player causes the raft to overbalance, their opponents receive points based on the number and type of their own men who were on the raft at that time.

The first player to reach fifty points is the winner.

Name: Demolition Derby
Description:
From the box: "You do the steering - smash the pop-up cars - race the closing gate"

The plastic gameboard, which is about 13" square, has a series of two-dimensional colored plastic target cars set on it which are triggered by rubber bands located beneath the board. A small area of the board is sectioned off (the Pits) behind a gate which serves as the timing mechanism for each person's turn.  A small car (the 'Demon') that relies on a ball bearing for mobility is placed behind the gate which is released by an opponent when all the targets are in position.

The instructions describe several variations of the game but all basically involve bumping into as many of the target cars with the Demon as possible and returning to the Pits before the timing gate closes.

Name: Destinations Secrètes
Description: This game is about traveling the world by visiting some of the 80 interesting sites. Each player receives secret missions (destinations to reach) but has to find them by resolving enigmas. There may occur lucky or unhappy events, unplanned voyages... a passioned race across the whole world.

Name: Heinz Sielmanns Expeditionen ins Tierreich
Description:
Insightful discoveries in the garden. Kids learn which animals are to find in (European) gardens, what they do and what they eat, who their foes are and why we should protect them.
The game consists of a map showing a garden with a biotope, markers in 6 colors,  6 dice, and 32 cards with animals and of course the rules.

Name: Scoop
Description:
Game in Swedish Only

Scoop is a card game where you build tabloid headlines. The juicier the better. Can you match the minister and the nanny? The sect leader and the pornstar? You decide.

Name: The Yacht Race Game
Description:
From Margaret Hofer's Book 'The Games We Played'.

The setting for this game The Yacht Race Game is New York Harbor where boats sail in the shadows of the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn Bridge, and Governor's Island. The course itself is divided into sections or spaces numbered from 1 to 83 inclusive, the connection on the return is taken up at space 63. The outside course is only to be used in case of a tie.

The course: The yachts start at square 1 and proceed along the course and around the lightship following spaces as they are listed reaching space 88 and then passing to space 63 to go back on the home stretch returning to space 11 which is located between buoy 15 and the Flagship boat which is the finish line.

Name: The Popular Game of Broadway
Description:
The Popular Game of Broadway celebrates four of the historic thoroughfare's architectural landmarks:
The Metropolitan Life Towers (built in 1909) The Times Tower (1903), the Flatiron Building (1902) and the Woolworth Building (1913). The game offers players the thrill of the big city within the comforts of the parlor - a perfect armchair traveling experience. -- from the book The Games We Played by Margaret Hofer (2003).

This is a variation on Pachisi, strongly related to Milton Bradley's Parcheesi, but obviously, marketed by a competitor. In his biography of Parker Brothers, The Game Makers, Philip Orbanes describes Broadway as a deliberate attempt to re-theme their popular seller, Pollyanna, for boys. Ultimately, Broadway was dropped after the 1933 catalog, while Pollyanna persisted for most of another four decades.

Name: Rival Policemen
Description:
from an article written by Margaret Hofer in the book "The Games we Played"

This McLoughlin game comes with vivid graphics and an oversized box which probably makes it one of the companies best games. Players representing rival police forces compete to capture the greatest number of crooks roaming the city's streets. Rival Policemen was inspired by a tense period in New York City's history when a state controlled police force and the city's police force worked simultaneously (but not necessarily cooperatively) to protect the city.

Name: Chips are Down
Description: This is a guessing game from Ideal. There is a table that holds chips. You guess how many chips will remain on the table and then you press a lever which releases some of the chips. You guess how many will be released to win them.

Name: Samurai Lords: The Wars of Feudal Japan
Description:
Originally published in 1983, Samurai Lords has been enjoyed by Japanese for decades and remains to this day, the Japanese gamer's strategic game of choice for simulating the most turbulent period in Japanese history. This is by far the most comprehensive game on Japanese history ever published.

Players scheme, plot, plan, fight, and deal with unforeseen events in the quest to become the supreme Samurai on the land. With 26 scenarios to represent periods ranging from the 12th to the 16th century and with some 500 major samurai that vied for power during this the long period of civil war individually represented, players will gain a unique insight into the inner workings of feudal Japan.

Samurai Lords scale:
Game Turn: 1 year
Counters: Individual Leaders and 1000 men per strength point
Map: Area map representing feudal Japan

Name: Petra, Paul & Co.
Description:
Petra, Paul & Co. is an educational game about decisions made in the local politics to improve your home town.

The Players act as local parties and try to get enough influence from the other players to fulfill their agendas.
If an agenda is fulfilled, the corresponding part of the gaming board is flipped over to show the improvement. The game ends if a player has fulfilled all of his agendas.

In their turn the players move on the board according to a die roll. They can change direction in 90 degrees but only once in their turn. If they get to another player or to a space that is connected to their agenda, they collect votes. if they get to the library or the newspaper, the players can answer a trivia question to collect another vote. The votes are collected on a separate board, witch shows the game progress. If a players stops at the town hall, a poll is executed. The wining agenda gets as many votes, as players take part.

The game is a clear educational game with easy mechanism for quick explanation.

Name: Winemakers: El juego del vino
Description:
Winemakers allows the players to live the experience to become an owner of a wine cellar. In Winemakers, players acquire property in wine-growing zones (at Mendoza, Argentina), select and plant the suitable wine varieties, harvest, elaborate,  bottle, label and place wines in national and international markets

Each player has a million wine dollars, the official coinage in the game, and with that money must travel the 5 circles that represents the process of wine making.
If your dice-rolls are not good you can have earth tremors, ice storms, or even go bankrupt.

And most important: You play it drinking a bottle of wine!

Game contains: 

    1 gameboard
    2 dice
    74 cards of properties and values
    8 corks of different colors
    74 cards of events
    12 millions wine dollars


Home Page: http://www.eljuegodelvino.com/

Name: Cuberty
Description: 'Word games grow up in Cuberty'  -  Cuberty is a 3D word game played with cubes.  Words are formed using stackable cubes.  Where Cuberty differs from other word games is that words can be formed vertically as well as horizontally, using the black and red lettered side of the cubes, but also the blank sides to provide spaces between the words.

Name: De Verbis
Description:
De Verbis is a promotional word-formation game from Linguamón - House of languages and it can be played in various languages. From the rules booklet:

        "Only one thing is more fun than guessing words: getting others to do it. In DE VERBIS, players take turns at thinking up and guessing words. The player who does it best wins the round."


Contents:

     45 letter cards
     10 "?" cards
     30 counters
     A pen and paper are needed for keeping score


Summary of rules:
In each round one of the players thinks a 8-10 letter word and marks it with the "?" cards on the table and keeps the deck of letter cards. The other players are given some tokens and, in turn, they ask for a letter: if it is included in the word, the player with the deck of cards places that letter in its correct position on top of the corresponding "?" card; if the letter is not in the word, the player who asked for it must pay 1 token. Whenever a player guesses the word correctly he receives 2 tokens plus as many tokens as "?" cards are still in the word; but if the guessed word is wrong, the player must pay 2 tokens. The player who thought the word receives as many tokens as the difference between the top scorer and the least scorer.

Following the philosophy of the publisher the rules are in Catalan, Spanish, English, French, Basque, Galician, Occitan and Italian.

About the publisher:
The publisher, Linguamón – House of Languages, is a body set up by the Government of Catalonia with the aim of promoting the world's languages as a:

     vehicle for communication, civilization and dialog 
     source of personal development, human creativity and heritage of mankind 
     right of individuals and of linguistic communities

Name: Official Radio Baseball Game
Description: OFFICIAL RADIO BASEBALL board game.  This game was intended to played along with the game on the radio, or with separate rules without the radio.  Features quite a few great teams of the day.  Colorful graphics  of players in action on the front of the game along with a classic image of a radio announcer.  Made by TOY CREATIONS, N.Y., N.Y.

Name: Zion
Description: ZION was produced by the "Later Day Saints - Mormons" and advertised as a family quiz game with separate questions for adults and children. Originally published by Bookcraft in 1959. Over 600 questions on the Bible, Book of Mormon, Church History and miscellaneous subjects. Includes a game board making it easier to keep track of who is winning. Also included are questions for children so the whole family can play. Great for Family Night, Seminary, Sunday School or Primary.

Name: Woody Woodpecker's Crazy Mixed-Up Color Factory Game
Description:
Game includes Woody Woodpecker, A Color Factory Wheel, A Color Factory Platform, 48 paint chips and a spinner. From the cover; "Help poor confused Woody straighten up his crazy mixed up color factory."

Ages 5-10

Name: No Brainer
Description:
No Brainer is a wacky game of “yes” and “no” questions. Strap the “brain” on your head, then wait for it to ask you questions. Then, nod yes or no and be amazed as it tells you if you’re right or not! Be careful, the questions keep coming faster as you play the game. You thought the questions were easy but are they really a No-Brainer?

--from the publisher

Name: Alamo to Appomattox
Description:
American Civil War wargaming rules for army level games being played with 2mm miniatures.

Enables entire battles of the size of Gettysburg to be played on a normal size wargaming table, with each battalion being represented by its own stand.

The rules are based on the Blenheim to Balaclava rules with modifications added to account for the specifics of the American Civil War

Name: Dirtside
Description:
DIRTSIDE is a D6 based rules system designed for playing out table-top miniatures actions simulating Armour and Infantry actions in a Science-Fiction setting, whether on Earth or other worlds.

It is a generic system allowing players to generate arms and armor from any setting they choose.

The rules are aimed primarily at 1/300 miniatures but can easily be used at any scale.

Rules cover Infantry, Armour, Artillery, Air Support and even Battle-walkers.

Some of the mechanisms include Multiphase turns, Overwatch, Line of Sight, ECM and Time-on-target.

This set of rules was followed up by the more detailed and better produced DIRTSIDE II rules (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/5687).

Name: Ovalia
Description:
An original CARD GAME inspired by international RUGBY!

Goal : mark points by achieving remarkable card associations.

Issued from rugby, there are associations which are worth a try (5 points) or a drop-goal (3 points). Tries can be converted adding 2 more points. Finally, there is the risk to get a Red Card which freezes a card and cancels the corresponding combination.

MATERIAL

80 cards forming 5 families of 16 cards each. The emblems represent the most famous international rugby squads in "Ovalia" :

The Wallabies / England / Les Bleus / The All Blacks / The Springboks

Every family has 15 numbered cards from 1 to 15 representing the players of a rugby team, and a supplementary one representing a "red card".

Name: Super Stick Super Jock Hockey
Description: Similar to other Super Jock games, the player pounds the jocks head to propel the puck.  The other player is the goalie, which is a plastic piece with a handle, and tried to prevent the jock from scoring.  The players take turns trying to score and the winner is the one that scores the most.

Name: Super Jock Soccer
Description: Like all Super Jock games, the player pounds the head of the jock to propel the ball.  The jock player tries to score and the defender controls the goalkeeper.  The players take turns trying to score and whoever scores most wins.

Name: Strawberry Shortcake Housewarming Surprise
Description:
From the bottom of the box:

Equipment: Game board, 4 International Friends movers and 4 plastic bases, 24 cards: 20 Recipe cards and 4 Captain Cackle cards, a movement spinner, Strawberry Shortcake / Purple Pieman die, Strawberry Shortcakes's Housewarming Surprise Recipe Booklet

Object: All is not well in Strawberryland!  The Purple Pieman dropped in on Strawberry Shortcake's surprise housewarming party, and stole her housewarming present.  Now he has the "berry" special recipes from her "berry" special International Friends.  It's up to you and your friends to get the recipes back.  Move from room to room in Strawberry Shortcake's new house, collecting the Recipe cards.  The one who has the most Recipe cards at the end of the game is the winner!

Name: Mizzouopoly
Description:
This variation of Monopoly is based on the campus of the University of Missouri, Columbia which is affectionately known as Mizzou.

The object is to buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board.  Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas.  Academic Probation sends you home . . . or make the Dean's List and collect a $200 scholarship.  Play the traditional version or the 1 hour version.  Fun for any alumnus, present or future student or fan.

Name: The Amazon Hop
Description:
From the press release:

Teach little ones good behavior, manners and social skills while having lots of swinging, screeching and squawking fun. This game comes with 50 question cards,16 lily pads and stone foam pieces, and a Jungle Activity wheel. When a child answers a question correctly and hops to the next foam pad, the spinner is spun and he acts out one of 16 activities, such as "Hop like a tree frog," or "Trumpet like an elephant." The finish line marks the crossing of the "Amazon River."

Name: Piratack
Description:
From the press release:

Aaarr! Hoist your sails and set your course for high seas adventure in Piratack. This thrilling new board game beckons you into a world where all can join in swashbuckling fun. Players must throw caution to the winds as their ships voyage through tranquil and stormy seas or pass through whirlpools. Ships must trade cargo to increase their strength in cannons because when time runs out…
                You can’t escape…
                                PIRATACK!
In the end, the fiercest will battle for the ultimate sovereign rule as Piratitan!

Name: Piratitan
Description:
From the press release:

Aarrr! Piratitans are back. In this fast-paced card game you pick your victims and seize their treasure! You can try to escape but beware... You can’t outrun Piratitans! Unpredictable fun for everyone! Kids won’t even know it’s educational when they battle each other with ships loaded with cannons

Name: Coin Hopping: Washington DC
Description:
From the press release:

Scatter some coins on the board and you are ready to play Coin Hopping-Washington DC, a game of strategy.  Coin Hopping Washington DC is a board game with global appeal.  International travelers with thoughts about visiting Washington DC will find this game as indispensable as their guide books. The game board, a beautiful map of the National Mall and surrounding areas, invites exploration of the city and its landmarks. Game includes fifty destination cards with pictures of things to see. It’s a patriotic experience all Americans will find engaging.  Players vie to become President, appoint Supreme Court Justices, and they even vote in Congress to change the rules of the game! The game is fast paced and topical as all eyes turn toward the next US election year in 2008.

Name: Gridlock
Description:
From the press release:

This double-sided board game offers two games in one. In Gridlock Jr. Ages 5-10, players battle a huge traffic jam, directing traffic to get the police car to the crime scene and others where they need to be. Gridlock Sr. Ages 10 and up is more challenging, with vehicle breakdowns, time pressure, and no stop signs. “The special quality of this board game is that it is cooperative. All the players must work together to free up the traffic jam; otherwise, nobody will get anywhere. Sort of like real life!”

Name: American Chopper DVD BoardGame
Description:
From the press release:

This game for two or more players takes participants into Orange County Choppers (the shop where the show takes place) to face numerous tasks, tight deadlines, unexpected surprises and the wrath of Paul, Sr. himself.  It features hundreds of challenges, games, trivia and clips, and is hosted by Mike Rowe, the official voice of American Chopper. Each space on the board corresponds with on screen action, and players must answer questions to earn bike parts in six different production stages for the win

Name: Homogenius
Description:
From the press release:

Homogenius, the gay trivia board game, celebrates gay culture and explores the contributions that gay personalities have made to theater, music, movies, television, publishing and politics. The object of this board game, which comes packaged in a stylish trunk-like box, is to “come out of the closet” by correctly answering a series of gay trivia questions in two categories: Rumor and Potpourri. Players start “In the Closet” and whoever gets “Out of the Closet” first wins. The game includes 355 question cards, 6 game tokens, 1 die and a colorful game board.

Name: Roxy's Eat Right Board Game
Description:
Join Roxy and her friends on a quest to find healthy foods. The Roxy's Eat Right board game teaches children about the food groups, the food pyramid, calories, vitamins and minerals, how to make balanced meals, and how to identify junk foods. The box contains one fold-out 20" x 20" game sheet and 51 Eat Right Cards. The game sheet is 2-sided (2 games), plus there are rules for 2 other games to play with just the cards.

Each card highlights a common food item in beautifully colored graphics illustrated by former Disney cartoonist, Clifford Dunston.

• Each card shows the number of servings of the food group for which it pertains.

• Each card shows the typical number of calories in the food item.

• Each card has a "Vitamin Power" rating and a "Junk Factor" rating. These ratings are calculated using a formula based on the content of vitamins, minerals and junk ingredients (fat, cholesterol, added sugars and sodium) as a percentage of the Recommended Daily Allowance (RDA)

• Each card is given an "Overall Rating" based on a formula using Vitamin Power per Calorie and Junk Factor per Calorie.

• Each card has a short description of the good and bad characteristics of the food item.

• The cards are color-coded by food group acording to MyPyramid.

• Each deck comes with 3 different games: Duel, Snack Attack, and Build-A-Meal - find even more game rules here.

• Each of the games will help kids to form healthy eating habits. Players are rewarded for choosing good foods to eat and penalized for eating junk foods.

• Teachers can use these cards in the classroom as an fun teaching tool - kids just love the cards!

http://www.educationalcardgames.com/6.html
 http://www.shopatron.com/product/part_number=0152/331.0.8884.0.0.0.0

Name: Quran Challenge Game: 600 Quran Questions
Description:
From the press release

This unique game, based on the Holy Quran, provides children with both fun and education. All questions are taken from the Quran and have been creatively worked into the game so that children will enjoy answering them.

Home Page: http://www.goodwordbooks.com/BookDetails.asp?Book_ID=8

Name: VitiVini
Description:
From the Press release:

VitiVini is a fun new card game that is based on wine and how to pair it with food. We have put an entire course on wine into a fun game that does not require you to know anything about wine to have fun playing it. The game is played with Question Cards that have three questions on three difficulty levels, Fact Cards in five different categories (Grapes, Regions, Wine Making, History, and Food Pairing), six types of Wild Cards (Challenge, Confiscate, Money, Return, Skip, and Reverse), and Coins. Players take turns answering questions to earn Fact Cards and Coins that they can use towards creating a winning hand. A die is also included for players who want to randomize question selection. The game is accompanied by a brochure containing an overview on wine, the wine regions, maps, and the rules to the game.

Name: Speed Limit
Description:
From the press release:

Whether on land, in the air, or even underwater in a new submarine, players must follow rules to survive, and avoid getting caught going over the speed limit. This exciting game tests players’ abilities to obey traffic laws and use the proper speed to become the race ace. “Speed Limit helps players become familiar with various kinds of transportation while improving their skills at adding and subtracting numbers,”

Name: Escape
Description:
From the press release:

The game has 108 cards for three to six players. Kids and adults can match wits against opponents while trying to rid themselves of all the cards in their hands. But in this new card game, opponents can openly discuss how to stop each other (within limits). Trying to stop someone from going out normally occurs when a player only has 2 or 3 cards left in his or her hand. The game scenario is in constant change. One minute a player is on offense, trying to win himself. The next minute he’s on defense as he works individually or as a team with other players to stop someone from going out.

Name: Professor Noggin's Geography of the United States
Description:
From the press release:

Players collect 30 sturdy, illustrated cards by correctly answering knowledge-based questions. Game play challenges memorization skills. A special three-numbered die creates interactive play, while Noggin’s Choice turns allow players to take cards from their opponents. There are two levels of difficulty for children of different ages and abilities.

Name: Hinck
Description:
Hinck is played on a 9 by 9 field board. Every player has 40 pieces, meaning that only the center square is unoccupied when the game starts.

The goal of the game is to get rid of your own pieces. You can do this by capturing your own pieces or by forcing your opponent to capture them. Capturing is done by jumping over an opponent similar to checkers. You must capture if you are able to. If you are able to make another capture after a capture move you must do so. (again, like in checkers)

You can only move horizontally.
Twice in the game you can skip your turn.

Name: The Irish Rhyming Game
Description: A simple roll-and-move game which is designed to give even footing to children and adults.  Be the first around the board rhyming your words before the timer runs out and you win.  On each move, a player rolls the die and selects a card from the appropriate deck.  They then have 30 seconds to list words that rhyme with the word on the card.  The number on the die indicates how many rhyming words they need to name, and if the succeed, that is how many spaces they move ahead.  The cards for adults have more difficult words.  Manufacturers recommend the game for ages 5 through adult.

Name: Een Dijk van een Spel
Description:
In Een Dijk van een Spel 2 to 4 player play a dikereef and must protect low-lying areas (dike-rings) with dikes. The first dikereef, to successfully protect 4 areas in two different regions is declared the winner. Storms and high water makes this a difficult job, though.

Een Dijk van een Spel(literally translated: "a dike of a game") is a game published by the dutch Ministry of Transport, Public Works and Water Management. It features all 53 dike-rings in the Netherlands - areas that need to be protected against the sea and/or rivers.

Name: Show Me Yours, I'll Show You Mine
Description:
From the box:

From the Inventor of Taboo, Outburst, and Malarky comes a new game.

It’s Simple...just write down 5 answers to the topic, then guess which of your friends have the same answer. Choose wisely…your points depend on it. It’s Revealing...some friends will match your answers...some won’t even be close. It’s Perfect for Parties...any size group will do. It’s all about a good time, laughs, and fun.

Contains:

6 viewers 
6 dry-wipe markers 
12 ALL IN chips 
6 ME TOO cards 
Wipe-off score card 
One-minute timer 
Topic cards

Name: Operations of SS Panzer Abteilung 102 in the Normandy Campaign
Description:
Operations of SS Panzer Abteilung 102 in the Normandy is one of the first (or THE first?) Critical Hit modules for ASL. It is a campaign game, yet not based on Critical Hit's Platoon Leader system.

Contents:  
- 4 pages of rules
- 1 large overlay (of Hill 112 - half an ASL board)
- 12 unmounted Tiger counters

Name: All Around Town
Description:
From the Press Release:

All Around Town is played on a high-quality felt mat with detailed town and road graphics. Players travel to the Doctor, Dentist, Fire Station, Police Station and elsewhere as directed by the playing cards, either spending or earning money while obeying stoplights and road signs. Parents can interact with children and teach valuable health and safety facts during the fun, educational game.

Name: Word Chase
Description:
From the Press Release:

The goal of this game is to familiarize children with “sight words,” the 25 most commonly used words in the English language. It includes a game board, 50 word cards, four game pieces and rules. It features only lower-case letters, and accommodates children younger than 4 who are learning to identify letters. The game printed with soy-based ink on recycled paper.

Name: Hobkirk Hill: Battles of the American War of Independence – Volume 1
Description:
A tactical DTP wargame based on a system that appeared in the earlier Vimeiro game. Te game looks remarkably simple. The British have only 15 units, while the Americans have 23 units.

Components:
Color Cover Sheet 
13" x 19" Map
128 die-cut Counters
Rulebook
Charts and Tables

All components come in a ziploc bag.

Name: Cowpens: Battles of the American War of Independence – Volume 2
Description:
A DTP wargame based on the earlier Vimeiro game by the same game designer, and is the second in the American Revolutionary War series after Hobkirk Hill. Components are similar to Hobkirk Hill.

Components:
13" x 19" Map
128 die-cut Counters
Rulebook
Charts and Tables

All components come in a ziploc bag.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Chippawa: The Birth of the United States Army
Description:
DTP wargame that covers the battle at Chippawa during the War of 1812 at the battalion-level. Based on the system that appeared in the earlier Vimeiro game by the same game designer.

Components:
178 die-cut counters
1 11 x 17-inch color map
2 info card sheets
Rulebook
Charts

Name: Getta Letter
Description: From the publisher: "Test your skills in categories of food, destinations, pop culture and much more with Getta Letter, a fast-thinking, letter-flipping category game where players race to determine the most words from A to Z in a particular category."

Name: Uberzuiker Presents Pele's World Football
Description: From the publisher: "A high-octane sports game that simulates real World Cup soccer, from Anthony E. Zuiker, the creator of CSI."

Name: Personology
Description:
Personology is a boardgame controlled by a video tape.

On your turn you'll have to guess the name of a famous personality. You'll be presented a blurry picture, a quote or something similar.

If you guess correctly within 7 seconds you get to roll the dice and double your movement.
If you guess correctly between 8 and 15 seconds you get to roll the dice and move normally.
If you fail to guess within 15 seconds the other players can try to guess themselves. If another player guesses correctly, he steals your turn.

Each correct guess also gains the player a chance card. These cards break the rules in various ways.

First player to reach the finish wins.

Name: Bling Bling
Description:
The board game that features Hip Hop's favorite Dice game, C-Lo or 456.

Rappers Rap about it, Singers sing about and now you and your friends can play it at home.

Make moves, buy property and accumulate money.  Be the best player at erecting urban city projects and you can be the winner at Bling Bling.

Coming to a hood near you.

Name: Kock 1939
Description:
The battle took place from October 2 through October 5, 1939 in eastern Poland. It was the last battle of the 1939 invasion of Poland and was fought between the the Polish Independent Operational Group 'Polesie' and the German XIV Motorized Corps.


Wikipedia: Battle of Kock
